translated: Itivuttaka
The Group of Threes
The Fifth Section
The Bondage of Sensual Pleasure

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One:

original: “Kāmayogayutto, bhikkhave, bhavayogayutto āgāmī hoti āgantā itthattaṁ.
analyzed: kāma yoga yuttaḥ bhikkhave bhava yoga yuttaḥ āgāmī hoti āgantā itthatta
translated: “Monks, one who is bound by the bondage of sensual pleasure and the bondage of becoming is a once-returner, one who comes back again to this human state.

original: Kāmayogavisaṁyutto, bhikkhave, bhavayogayutto anāgāmī hoti anāgantā itthattaṁ.
analyzed: kāma yoga visayuttaḥ bhikkhave bhava yoga yuttaḥ anāgāmī hoti anāgantā itthatta
translated: Monks, one who is unbound by the bondage of sensual pleasure but bound by the bondage of becoming is a non-returner, one who does not come back to this human state.

original: Kāmayogavisaṁyutto, bhikkhave, bhavayogavisaṁyutto arahā hoti, khīṇāsavo”ti.
analyzed: kāma yoga visayuttaḥ bhikkhave bhava yoga visayuttaḥ arahā hoti khīṇa āsavaḥ ti
translated: Monks, one who is unbound by the bondage of sensual pleasure and unbound by the bondage of becoming is a Worthy One, one whose effluents are ended.”
The Blessed One said this.

analyzed: tattha itam iti vuccati  kāma yogena sayuttā
translated: And in connection with this, it was said:🔽“Those beings who are bound🔽by both the bondage of sensual pleasure
and the bondage of becoming
go on wandering through birth & death,
going to birth & death.
But those who, having abandoned sensual pleasure,
have not reached the ending of effluents,
bound by the bondage of becoming,
are said to be non-returners.
But those whose doubts are cut,
whose effluents are ended, whose rebirths are ended,
they have gone to the far shore of the world,
having reached the ending of effluents.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This, too, was the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
The seventh.
The third recitation-section.
